intro: Phyllanthus kaalaensis, commonly known as the Kaalaensis spurge, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested or shaded areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
